article.headline: Niagara 78, American 71
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Juan Mendez poured in a game-high 30 points to lead Niagara to a 78-71 win over visiting American in a non-conference game Saturday night. Mendez, who also had game highs of nine rebounds and six steals, had 15 points in each half for Niagara (1-1). David Brooks scored 18 points, Alvin Cruz had 13 and Lorenzo Miles added 11 points for Niagara, which holds a 3-1 lead in the overall series. Matej Cresnik led American (0-2) with 17 points. Raimondas Petrauskas had 16 points off the bench, while Ryan Graham had 12 points in a reserve role. The American bench outscored Niagara's reserves 33-6, but American's starters, with the exception of Cresnik and Andre Ingram, who had nine points, seven rebounds and six assists, struggled. American, which shot 52.9 percent from the field (27-of-51), hurt itself with 14 turnovers. Niagara, which had just eight turnovers, outrebounded American 33-29. Niagara led 40-39 at halftime.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
